edus: I was excited to try this new sushi restaurant
and the fish didn't taste fresh

relations.description: EDUs 1 and 2 present contrasting attitudes toward the restaurant - initial excitement versus subsequent disappointment.
These three complaints about the restaurant (lighting, service, and food quality) are presented as parallel issues of equal importance.
The specific complaints in relation r2 elaborate on why 'the excitement quickly faded' from EDU 2, providing detailed reasons.
EDU 7 ('I won't be coming back') is the effect or result, while EDU 6 ('Because of all these issues') is the cause or reason. The decision not to return is the main point.
The decision not to return (r4) is a direct result of the negative experience detailed in r3. This relation connects the issues with their outcome.
Root relation connecting multiple discourse components.
